questions.statement: Honey never spoils and edible honey has been found in Egyptian tombs
questions.explanation: Archaeologists have found 3000-year-old honey in Egyptian tombs that was still perfectly edible due to honey's low moisture content and acidic pH.

questions.statement: The Great Wall of China is visible from space with the naked eye
questions.explanation: Despite popular belief, the Great Wall is not visible from space without aid. It's too narrow (about 5-8 meters wide) to be seen from orbital distances.
Octopuses have two branchial hearts that pump blood through the gills and one systemic heart that pumps blood through the body.

questions.statement: Lightning never strikes the same place twice
questions.explanation: Lightning frequently strikes the same place multiple times. Tall structures like the Empire State Building are struck about 20-25 times per year.

questions.statement: Cleopatra lived closer in time to the Moon landing than to the construction of the Great Pyramid
questions.explanation: The Great Pyramid was completed around 2560 BCE, Cleopatra lived around 30 BCE, and the Moon landing was 1969 CE. About 2500 years separate Cleopatra from the pyramids, but only ~2000 years from the Moon landing.

questions.statement: Goldfish have a memory span of only 3 seconds
questions.explanation: Goldfish actually have memories that last for months. They can be trained to respond to certain light cues and remember them for extended periods.

questions.statement: Bananas are berries, but strawberries are not
questions.explanation: Botanically, a berry develops from a single ovary and has seeds embedded in the flesh. Bananas qualify, but strawberries are 'accessory fruits' with seeds on the outside.

questions.statement: Humans only use 10% of their brain
questions.explanation: Brain imaging shows that we use virtually every part of the brain, just not all at once. Different activities engage different regions.
questions.source: Ten percent of the brain myth

questions.statement: Venus is the only planet in our solar system that rotates clockwise
questions.explanation: Both Venus and Uranus rotate clockwise (retrograde rotation). Venus rotates very slowly, taking 243 Earth days for one rotation.

questions.statement: A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus
questions.explanation: Venus takes 243 Earth days to rotate once on its axis, but only 225 Earth days to orbit the Sun, making its day longer than its year.
